title: Witnesses' horror after woman falls from ride at Hull Fair leaving 'lots of blood'
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Eyewitnesses reacted with horror after a woman was thrown '10 to 15 feet' into the air from a ride at Hull Fair.

The woman, now recovering in hospital, had riding been on the Airmaxx 360 which has since been shut down.

She was thrown from the ride at the travelling fair and landed on a small boy nearby who suffered minor injuries.

The Health and Safety Executive is investigating and it is believed she fell from one ride onto the base of another nearby. Both were closed last night.

Eye-witnesses described seeing the woman “fly off” the ride, and paramedics were seen treating her before she was quickly taken to hospital.

(Image: Hull Live/MEN MEDIA)

(Image: Stephen Gleno / SWNS)

One witnesss told Hull Live: “The bar failed and a girl just came flying off it while it was in motion. It’s at the back in the corner near West Park.

“It’s been shut and the emergency services are there. There is a lot of blood. It doesn’t look good.”

The woman's injuries have been assessed as serious but not life-threatening, according to Humberside Police.

One man said: “We were on the way out as this happened and saw medics running by but assumed someone maybe collapsed.

"It's shocking. I’m sending my best wishes to the lady.”

Amy Louise Jackson, 25, did not see what happened but turned up to go on the ride. She said: "It's scary. That's one of the rides I normally go on that one.

“When I hear stories like this, I won't go on them again. It puts you off. It makes you think twice about health and safety.”

(Image: Stephen Gleno / SWNS)

Another witness said: "I was nearby but I didn't see it happen, I was standing on the other side.

"I just heard a shout and then the ride was quickly shut down."

One woman pushing a pram through the fair said: "It's scary. It is not like this it is the first time it has happened."

It has since emerged the Airmaxx 360 is believed to be the same model involved in a fatal accident in 2014 which killed eight-year-old Adelene Leong in Adelaide five years ago.

Adelene, who was on holiday from her native Malaysia was thrown ten metres from her seat in 2014.

(Image: SA Police)

Chief Inspector Paul Kirby, tactical commander for Hull Fair, said: "A woman has sadly been seriously injured Hull Fair and taken to hospital by ambulance.

"We do not believe her injuries are life threatening or life changing.

"A teenage boy was struck by the woman as she fell. He thankfully only sustained minor injuries.

"We have very well established plans in place with the council for any incident like this at the fair, and I want to thank everyone for their patience while we deal with this.

"I am appealing for anyone who might have seen what happened, or who has any video footage of it to contact us."
description: The woman had been on the Airmaxx 360 which has been shut down by officials at Hull Fair
